It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and composite flower heads that typically consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that can reach up to 30 centimeters in height. Tritomodon subsessilis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is also known for its role in supporting pollinator populations.
